sentence.text: Gentranscription by RNA polymerase IIlized epilepsies, particularly the idiopathic or genetic generalized epilepsies (GGEs), represent some of the most common epilepsies.

The first decade of the 21st century was marked by progress in understanding the basic biology of gentranscription by RNA polymerase IIlized epilepsies including generalized/genetic epilepsies with febrile seizures plus (GEFS+) and GGE through studies of large families, discovering causative mutations in cardiac muscle cell action potential involved in contraction, SCN1B, inhibitory synapse assembly, and GABRA1.

entity.text: cardiac muscle cell action potential involved in contraction

sentence.text: Genes for epileptic encephalopathies such as protein-containing complex assembly were rediscovered in GGE, highlighting the biological continuum between different epilepsies.
